Package: org.jlab.analysis

[Groovy] Class MLClient

    • org.jlab.analysis.MLClient 
    • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class MLClient
extends java.lang.Object

      Connects to a remote machine learning model server to classify input data.

      Version:
      1.0
      Authors:
      Matthew McEneaney

        • java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> classify(java.lang.String jsonInput)

          Classify an event given raw JSON input.

          Parameters:
          jsonInput - The JSON string representing the input data.
          Returns:
          A list of classification scores.

        • java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> classify(Event event)

          Classify an event using the configured input banks.

          Parameters:
          event - The event to classify.
          Returns:
          A list of classification scores.

        • void createInputBanks(HipoReader reader)

          Initialize the input banks to read from each event.

          Parameters:
          reader - The HIPO reader to get schemas from.

        • java.lang.String createJsonInput(Event event)

          Create JSON input from the event and configured banks.

          Parameters:
          event - The event to convert to JSON.
          Returns:
          A JSON string representing the event data.

        • int getNScores()

          Get the number of expected output scores from the model.

          Returns:
          The number of output scores.

        • void setInputBankNames(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> bankNames)

          Set the list of input bank names to read from each event.

          Parameters:
          bankNames - The list of bank names to read.

        • void setNScores(int nScores)

          Set the number of expected output scores from the model.

          Parameters:
          nScores - The number of output scores.
